properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued February 14 at 1:40AM PST until February 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Building long period northwest swell will create steep
seas at 10 to 15 ft at 16 to 17 seconds this morning. In
addition, gusty north winds of 15 to 25 kt south of Cape Blanco
will create choppy wind driven seas this afternoon and evening.
Seas will gradually subside late tonight into Saturday morning
to 10 to 11 feet at 15 seconds.

* WHERE...All areas.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 10 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Building long period swell early this morning is
likely to increase the size of the surf zone as more breakers
occur. Use extra caution when crossing bars, as they are likely
to become especially dangerous. Additionally, gusty winds and/or
steep seas could capsize or damage smaller vessels.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should remain in port and avoid the area of hazardous
conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY
